required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: WallFlex Esophageal Fully Covered (FC) Benign Anastomotic Stricture
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Prospective, Randomized (RCT) Study Comparing WallFlexÂ® Esophageal Fully Covered (FC) Metal Stent to Bougie Dilation for the Treatment of Refractory Anastomotic Esophageal Strictures

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this of this study is to compare the safety and effectiveness of temporary indwell of the WallFlex Esophageal FC Metal Stent to Bougie Dilation for the treatment of refractory anastomotic esophageal strictures

primary_outcome.description: Number of dilation procedures for the management of dysphagia within 12 months following initial study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Technical Stent Placement Success
secondary_outcome.description: Technical stent placement success is defined as the ability to deploy the stent in satisfactory position across the stricture.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Technical Stent Removal Success
secondary_outcome.description: Technical stent removal success is defined as the ability to remove the stent without complications.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 2, Week 2, Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's satisfaction with the therapy (scored by a visual analog scale) assessed at day 2, week 2, month 1, month 2, month 3, month 6, month 9, and month 12. Patient Satisfaction with Therapy scale ranges from 0-10. The minimum on this scale is 0 (0 being completely unsatisfied with the therapy; a worse outcome) and the maximum on this scale is 10 (10 being completely satisfied with the therapy; a better outcome).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 2, Week 2, Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's report of pain (scored by a visual analog scale) assessed at Baseline, day 2, week 2, month 1, month 2, month 3, month 6, month 9, and month 12. Pain Numerical Rating Scale ranges from 0-10. The minimum on this scale is 0 (0 being no pain; a better outcome) and the maximum on this scale is 10 (10 being worst pain ever; a worse outcome).

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality Of Life Overall Health Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 2, Week 2, Month 1, Month 2, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life scale measuring overall health score assessed at day 2, week 2, month 1, month 2, month 3, month 6, month 9, and month 12. The scale is numbered from 0 to 100. 0 is the worst health the participant can imagine. 100 is the best health the participant can imagine. A lower score indicates a worse outcome. A higher score indicates a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and Severity of Adverse Events Related to the Stent/Bougie Dilator and/or the Procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence and severity of adverse events related to the stent/bougie dilator and/or the procedure.
Time to recurrence of dysphagia, defined as inability of a normal diameter gastroscope (9.8mm) to pass the stricture.
Total number of stent migrations with or without symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Reinterventions Within 12 Months Following the Initial Study Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Number of reinterventions within 12 months following the initial study treatment.

arm_group.description: The WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered Esophageal Stent System is being evaluated for treatment of refractory anastomotic esophageal strictures.
Esophageal Bougie Dilator commercially available devices used per Investigator preference are being evaluated for treatment of refractory anastomotic esophageal strictures.

intervention.intervention_name: WallFlex Esophageal RX Fully Covered Stent
intervention.description: Temporary placement of the WallFlex Esophageal RX Fully Covered Stent for treatment of refractory anastomotic esophageal strictures. The stent will be removed after 8 weeks (plus or minus 7 days) indwell

intervention.intervention_name: Esophageal Bougie Dilator Per Investigator preference
intervention.description: Commercially available Esophageal Bougie Dilator Per Investigator preference

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:Esophageal anastomotic stricture post esophagectomy (esophagogastric strictures).
- Esophagectomy performed at the same institution where patient enrollment and follow-up is planned.
- Two dilations to at least 16 mm in diameter since esophagectomy.
- 1st dilation no more than 6 months post esophagectomy and 2nd dilation within 6 months of 1st dilation to 16mm.
- Dysphagia score of 2 (ability to swallow semi-solid foods), 3 (ability to swallow liquids only) or 4 (unable to swallow liquids) at baseline.
- Unable to pass a standard endoscope (approx. 9.8 mm diameter).
- Age 18 years or older.
- Willing and able to comply with the study procedures and provide
Exclusion Criteria:Stricture within 2 cm of the upper esophageal sphincter.
- Dysphagia related to motility disorder.
- Non-anastomotic esophageal strictures.
- Esophagocolonic strictures.
- Planned adjuvant radiation therapy post esophagectomy.
- Prior esophageal stent placements post esophagectomy.
- Active erosive esophagitis.
- Sensitivity to any components of the stent or delivery system.
- Concurrent medical condition that would affect the investigator's ability to evaluate the patient's condition or could compromise patient safety. Participation in a clinical trial evaluating an investigational device within 3 months prior to enrollment in this study.
- Stricture length > 5 cm.

facility.name: Instituto do Cancer do Estado de Sao Paulo

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Dysphagia Score
measure.description: Dysphagia Scoring System (scale range from 0 to 4): Dysphagia Score = 0: ability to eat a normal diet Dysphagia Score = 1: ability to eat some solids Dysphagia Score = 2: ability to eat some semisolids only Dysphagia Score = 3: ability to swallow liquids only Dysphagia Score = 4: complete dysphagia A lower score indicates a better outcome. A higher score indicates a worse outcome.

measure.title: Quality of Life Overall Health Score
measure.description: Quality of life scale measuring overall health score. The scale is numbered from 0 to 100. 0 is the worst health the participant can imagine. 100 is the best health the participant can imagine. A lower score indicates a worse outcome. A higher score indicates a better outcome.

outcome.title: Number of Dilation Procedures
outcome.description: Number of dilation procedures for the management of dysphagia within 12 months following initial study treatment.

group.title: Metal Stent
group.description: The WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered Esophageal Stent System is being evaluated for treatment of refractory anastomotic esophageal strictures. measure.title: Number of Dilation Procedures
measure.description: Number of dilation procedures for the management of dysphagia within 12 months following initial study treatment.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Technical Stent Placement Success
outcome.description: Technical stent placement success is defined as the ability to deploy the stent in satisfactory position across the stricture.
outcome.population: Outcome measure only applicable to participants in the Metal Stent arm, as only participants in the Metal Stent arm received a stent. Participants in the Bougie Dilation arm did not receive a stent and therefore there is no data to collect regarding technical success of stent placement for the Bougie arm.

group.title: Metal Stent
group.description: The WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered Esophageal Stent System is being evaluated for treatment of refractory anastomotic esophageal strictures. WallFlex Esophageal RX Fully Covered Stent: Temporary placement of the WallFlex Esophageal RX Fully Covered Stent for treatment of refractory anastomotic esophageal strictures. The stent will be removed after 8 weeks (plus or minus 7 days) indwell

group.title: Bougie Dilation
group.description: Esophageal Bougie Dilator commercially available devices used per Investigator preference are being evaluated for treatment of refractory anastomotic esophageal strictures. Esophageal Bougie Dilator Per Investigator preference: Commercially available Esophageal Bougie Dilator Per Investigator preference

measure.title: Number of Participants With Technical Stent Placement Success
measure.description: Technical stent placement success is defined as the ability to deploy the stent in satisfactory position across the stricture.
measure.population: Outcome measure only applicable to participants in the Metal Stent arm, as only participants in the Metal Stent arm received a stent. Participants in the Bougie Dilation arm did not receive a stent and therefore there is no data to collect regarding technical success of stent placement for the Bougie arm.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Technical Stent Removal Success
outcome.description: Technical stent removal success is defined as the ability to remove the stent without complications.
outcome.population: Outcome measure only applicable to participants in the Metal Stent arm, as only participants in the Metal Stent arm received a stent and therefore underwent stent removal. Participants in the Bougie Dilation arm did not receive a stent and therefore there is no data to collect regarding technical success of stent removal for the Bougie arm.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data collected for events related to the stent/bougie dilator and/or the procedure, from the time the participant signed the informed consent and was randomized to the study, until completion of the 12 month follow-up visit (occurring 12 months post-initial study treatment).
reported_events.desc: Collected and reported only on those Adverse Events (Serious and Non-serious) related to the stent/bougie dilator and/or the procedure.

event.sub_title: Retching due to Foreign Body Sensation

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
